title: Kill la Kill Specials
content:
I have watched a lot of follow up specials for all sort of Anime, but never have I been left this down and uncared for.

This double-episode special does not only serve as extra for your typical hungry fan, but it also self-proclaims to be the direct follow up to the parent series, as an undirect ending that wraps everything else for good. Or at least, that's what one of the two episodes was, a dilemma where the main cast deals with Raygo's assistant, revealing more about her past and some hints that link up a few plot points that have been left off of themain storyline. I was not a big fan of the finale, I
  hated Ryuko's stupid out-of-nowhere power up. As a constraint, the animation was gorgeous, however, as I was so unfortunate as o watch the dub version, and don't get me wrong, I love my dubbed Anime, but this was just so bad I couldn't enjoy most of it.
As for the second episode, it was a recap around 9 minutes of length, I only got to find it in Spanish, and my Spanish is nowhere near getting comfortable to watch Anime in. But it was visually enjoyable, to say the least.
